step1.sentence: Reaching your long-term goals often requires adjusting your short-term plans along the way.

step2.story: The charity had set an ambitious fundraising goal and reached it with three days to spare. The executive director said the real achievement was not the number but the process — the way the community had rallied around a shared target.

step3.story: He had set the goal of reading fifty books in a year. By October he had read thirty-one and was behind pace. He considered dropping the target. Instead he reflected on what the goal had actually produced: a habit of reading daily that he had never managed before, a wider range of topics than he would have chosen without the challenge, and conversations sparked by books he would not have otherwise touched. He reached forty-four by December thirty-first. He had not reached the goal as stated. He had reached something more durable.

meaning.etymologyKo: reach는 물리적으로 손을 뻗어 닿는 이미지에서 비유적으로 목표 달성을 표현합니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: achieve a goal, meet a goal과 유사합니다. reach는 여정 끝에 도달하는 느낌을 강조합니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: She reached her fitness goal after six months of training.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 그녀는 6개월 훈련 끝에 건강 목표를 달성했어요.
